content.description: Climb just to the right of the tree and left of the arete.  Watch out for the pointed rock on the ground, it could be an ankle breaker.
content.location: swamp boulders

content.description: Start to the left of the small ledge on good holds and good feet.
content.location: Entrance boulder in the moose boulder area, south end

content.description:
Start on some good crimps, then bump up to a good right edge. Now for the crux, make a big move to a great edge/jug. Find your feet, get the lip and top out.  

  This is a great little line. There could be a sit start to this that could possibly go but it would probably be much harder.
content.protection: A pad, make sure to cover the weird stump well.
content.location: The Fin boulder, to the left of the fin.

content.description: Climb just to the right of the tree.
content.location: Entrance boulder in the moose boulder area, south end

content.description: The slightly overhanging section to the left of Bear King on the blank face.
content.location: swamp boulders

content.description: Sit-start in the hole with your right hand on a crimp and your left hand on a good hold.  Bump up to the right leaning crack and follow it right and up.
content.location: Swamp boulders

content.description:
Start on the horn just left of the tree, traverse left to the good match hold. Adjust your feet and push straight up/left. Start on the second hold for a nice warm-up.

Beta:

https://youtu.be/qyclUVAxmgU
content.location: Swamp boulders. Left of the tree left of Uncle Funky Pants.

content.description: Climb on good holds and good feet.
content.location: Entrance boulder in the moose boulder area, south end

content.description: Climb up the slightly left leaning and overhanging arete.
content.location: Entrance boulder in the moose boulder area, south end

climbs.name: Love Is A Dog From Hell

content.description: Sit start on a small rock up to crimps over the bulge and top out.  Harder than it looks.
content.location: Entrance boulder in the moose boulder area, south end

content.description: Boulder right next to the road across from the swamp thats diamond shaped.
content.location: swamp boulders

climbs.name: In The Court Of The Bear King

content.description: Start on a crimp and and a bad hold. Continue up on crimps to the point and topout. Really balancy and awesome.
content.location: swamp boulders

content.description: If you like slopers like i do this is a lot of fun.Start on the obvious good hold and on a side sloper, get your left foot on a tiny nub and heel hook to keep it from popping off. Slap up on side slopers to the next good hold and top out.
content.location: The fin boulder on the back side that overhangs.

content.description: Traverse from low to high (right to left) on the trail side of the Fin boulder.
content.location: Fin Boulder

content.description: Start on the small ledge and move up to the point.
content.location: Entrance boulder in the moose boulder area, south end

climbs.name: F**k Tony Danza I'm the Boss

content.description: Sit start and up to easier climbing.  high topout on slab
content.location: Entrance boulder in the moose boulder area, south end

content.description: Really fun and surprisingly technical problem. Start matched on the pretty obvious hold above a small rock on left side looking at the fin boulder. Traverse right and up to the great slope rail.Â
content.location: Back side of the fin boulder.

content.description:
Short but fun. 

  Sit start on slopers with a good left foot that might be reachy if your short.  As long as you start on the slopers the grade stays the same. The crux is keeping your feet from flying out and sliding off the slopers.  Now get your right hand in the envelope slot, then left hand into a great hold and up to a jug. Top out and walk off.
content.location: Swamp boulders

content.description: Climb or run up.
content.location: Entrance boulder in the moose boulder area, south end

content.description: Decent climb with a couple neat holds. Start balanced on the left side of the arete on an undercling sidepull. Work right around the arete to a great righthand pocket and head straight up.
content.location: Swamp boulders. Shares the start of Uncle Funky Pants

content.description: Sit start on a jug and crimp.  The crux is getting off the ground, now dyno or reach for the good left hand and top out.
content.location: swamp boulders

content.description: Sit start on the slightly overhanging section to the right of the tree.
content.location: Entrance boulder in the moose boulder area, south end

content.description:
"CAUTION: This is a popular hunting spot, if you come here during hunting season make sure you are wearing bright orange and have something bright on your pads, perhaps orange duct tape or surveyor's tape. [ COMMENT from Jake Perry ] 

  Bouldering near the base or Rand Mountain and Moose Mountain.  The area has a good variety of problems.  The Moose boulders have some mega-highballs and is a bit of a bushwhack to get there so I am going to be trying to establish some sort of trail.  The grades are an estimate so they may be off a bit and some problems may need some more cleaning. Also if you want me to show you the area or want to help cleaning off some problems send me a PM.
